negated.description: Flag to indicate whether the phenotype was observed or not. Default is 'false', in other words the phenotype was observed. It is only required in cases to indicate that the phenotype was looked for, but __not__ observed.

severity.description:
Severity of the condition e.g. subclasses of HP:0012824-Severity or SNOMED:272141005-Severities.
FHIR mapping: Condition.severity

info.description:
An individual phenotypic feature, observed as either present or absent (negated), with possible onset, modifiers and frequency.
FHIR mapping: Condition (https://www.hl7.org/fhir/condition.html) or Observation (https://www.hl7.org/fhir/observation.html)

longitude.description: signed decimal degrees (East, relative to IERS Reference Meridian)

latitude.description: signed decimal degrees (North, relative to Equator)

label.description:
A text representation, preferably using standard geographic identification elements, of the corresponding latitude,longitude(,altitude). This representation serves the purposes to
  - capture standard data entry parameters
  - provide a sanity check for latitude,longitude values

altitude.description: height in meters above the WGS 84 reference ellipsoid; otional

id.description: Properly prefixed CURIE of the external reference

relation.description: the relation of the external reference to the object it was pointed from

age_at_collection_class.description: The of the object (e.g. individual at tome of a biosample collection), as Ontology_class. object

value.description: the value in a format correstponding to type

description.example: The base length of the called segment.
description.description: an optional free-text annotation about the object

label.description: the text label associated with the term

id.description: properly prefixed CURIE of the ontology term

info.title: GA4GH SchemaBlocks - common and shared object definitions
info.description: Definition of some prototype objects which are re-used in other schema documents.
